metadata.title: CVE-2017-11671 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in i386.c inGNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5 before 5.5, and6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that clobber the statusflag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it can be read, potentiallycausing failures of these instructions to go unreported. This couldpotentially lead to less randomness in random number generation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-7 - 7.3.0-16ubuntu3
g++-7 - 7.3.0-16ubuntu3
g++-7-multilib - 7.3.0-16ubuntu3

criterions.comment: gcc-3.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-7 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.3.0-16ubuntu3').
gcc-snapshot package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:20180425-1ubuntu1').
